title: CVE-2018-17144 Duplicate Input Inflation Bug
summary: A regression in duplicate-input checks introduced potential inflation and denial-of-service risk in vulnerable Bitcoin Core versions.
impact: If exploited in a block, nodes could accept invalid state transitions or crash, threatening consensus safety.
mitigation: Upgrade to patched Bitcoin Core releases and follow conservative release/validation practices for consensus code.

title: Pre-SegWit Transaction Malleability
summary: Before SegWit, third parties could mutate transaction identifiers without changing spend intent, breaking txid-sensitive workflows.
impact: Operational systems depending on unconfirmed txid stability could fail, and second-layer protocol design became more fragile.
mitigation: Use SegWit transaction formats and avoid critical dependence on mutable unconfirmed txids in production workflows.

title: 2010 Value Overflow Incident
summary: An integer overflow bug in early Bitcoin software allowed an invalid inflation transaction to be mined.
impact: The incident temporarily violated supply rules and required urgent ecosystem coordination to restore valid chain history.
mitigation: Apply strict monetary range checks and maintain extensive consensus test coverage with conservative release engineering.
